He accused India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and threatened tariff hikes, prompting a strong rebuttal from India, which cited strategic necessity and questioned the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing their trade with Russia.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/international-business/trade-war-trump-was-asked-about-indias-claim-on-us-importing-russian-uranium-fertilisers-heres-his-response/articleshow/123131430.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/international-business/trade-war-trump-was-asked-about-indias-claim-on-us-importing-russian-uranium-fertilisers-heres-his-response/articleshow/123131430.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 08:38:02 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="31346" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123131560,imgsize-31346.cms"/></item><item><title>MoD clears big arms deals, including BrahMos, armed drones, worth Rs 67,000cr</title><description><![CDATA[India's defence ministry has approved the procurement of 87 armed drones and over 110 BrahMos missiles, along with other modernization proposals, totaling Rs 67,000 crore. The acquisition of MALE drones, to be produced with 60% indigenous content, aims to enhance the capabilities of the three services, while the BrahMos missiles will further strengthen the firepower of Sukhoi-30MKI fighters.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/mod-clears-big-arms-deals-including-brahmos-armed-drones-worth-rs-67000cr/articleshow/123127687.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/mod-clears-big-arms-deals-including-brahmos-armed-drones-worth-rs-67000cr/articleshow/123127687.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:59:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>RAJAT PANDIT</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="902556" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127691,imgsize-902556.cms"/></item><item><title>Uttarkashi disaster: Videos show Dharali wiped out in 20 seconds; buildings crumbled like cardboard pieces</title><description><![CDATA[Terrifying videos captured the moment a massive wave of water and debris devastated Dharali village in Uttarkashi district, flattening buildings and sweeping away people. The surge, triggered around 1:50 pm, reduced the bustling marketplace to rubble in seconds. Authorities have confirmed four deaths, but fear the toll could rise as rescue operations continue, with the Army, NDRF, and SDRF involved.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/horrifying-videos-capture-how-village-was-destroyed-in-20-secs/articleshow/123122969.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/dehradun/horrifying-videos-capture-how-village-was-destroyed-in-20-secs/articleshow/123122969.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 21:34:44 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GAURAV TALWAR</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="2608966" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123130949,imgsize-2608966.cms"/></item><item><title>Glacier collapse or lake burst likely caused Dharali destruction: Experts</title><description><![CDATA[Experts suspect a glacier collapse or glacial lake breach, not a cloudburst, caused the devastating flash flood in Dharali village, Uttarkashi. Minimal rainfall was recorded, leading scientists to investigate a potential avalanche or lake burst upstream. Satellite images reveal glaciers and glacial lakes above the site, raising concerns about a sudden water release similar to the Raini disaster.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/glacier-collapse-or-lake-burst-likely-caused-dharali-destruction-experts/articleshow/123127901.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/glacier-collapse-or-lake-burst-likely-caused-dharali-destruction-experts/articleshow/123127901.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:23:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="46224" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127903,imgsize-46224.cms"/></item><item><title>'Picked a team not to lose': Ex-India cricketer slams Gambhir-Gill approach</title><description><![CDATA[Dinesh Karthik criticised Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's leadership during the recent Test series against England, suggesting their cautious approach reflected a fear of defeat. Karthik highlighted Gambhir's significant influence on team decisions and emphasised the need to prioritise taking wickets. He also defended Jasprit Bumrah's workload management, dismissing claims that India performs better without him.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/picked-a-team-not-to-lose-former-india-cricketer-questions-gautam-gambhir-shubman-gill-approach-despite-2-2-draw-in-england/articleshow/123130452.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/picked-a-team-not-to-lose-former-india-cricketer-questions-gautam-gambhir-shubman-gill-approach-despite-2-2-draw-in-england/articleshow/123130452.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 07:03:08 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="118502" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123130474,imgsize-118502.cms"/></item><item><title>AI with a mind of its own: Godfather of AI Geoffrey Hinton raises alarm</title><description><![CDATA[Geoffrey Hinton, the 'Godfather of AI,' expresses concerns about AI developing its own incomprehensible language. He fears increasingly advanced and interconnected AI systems might communicate in a self-created language, potentially surpassing human intelligence. Hinton also questions AI's ability to create new jobs to offset job losses, highlighting the urgent threat of unemployment and its impact on human happiness.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/godfather-of-ai-geoffrey-hinton-says-he-is-scared-that-ai-may-develop-its-own-language-and-/articleshow/123117983.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/godfather-of-ai-geoffrey-hinton-says-he-is-scared-that-ai-may-develop-its-own-language-and-/articleshow/123117983.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 16:34:57 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="886207" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123117969,imgsize-886207.cms"/></item><item><title>Ex-DOGE employee aka ‘big balls’ assaulted in DC: Why was he attacked; who was behind it?</title><description><![CDATA[Edward Coristine, a former DOGE employee, was violently attacked during an attempted carjacking in DC's Logan Circle. He was defending a woman when a group of teenagers assaulted him, leading to the arrest of two 15-year-olds. The incident has fueled President Trump's call for federal control of DC, citing out-of-control crime and the need to try minors as adults.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/ex-doge-employee-edward-coristine-big-balls-assaulted-in-washington-dc-why-was-he-attacked-who-was-behind-it/articleshow/123130808.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/ex-doge-employee-edward-coristine-big-balls-assaulted-in-washington-dc-why-was-he-attacked-who-was-behind-it/articleshow/123130808.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 07:52:04 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="32056" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123130996,imgsize-32056.cms"/></item><item><title>Amit Shah now India's longest-serving home minister</title><description><![CDATA[Amit Shah has surpassed L.K. Advani to become the longest-serving Home Minister, a milestone celebrated by PM Modi who lauded Shah's tenure marked by key decisions such as the revocation of J&K's special status and the enactment of the CAA. Shah's leadership, including his role in Operation Sindoor, was highlighted as a testament to India's strong political resolve.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/amit-shah-now-indias-longest-serving-home-minister/articleshow/123127647.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/amit-shah-now-indias-longest-serving-home-minister/articleshow/123127647.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:37:45 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AKHILESH KUMAR SINGH</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="911701" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127650,imgsize-911701.cms"/></item><item><title>'Bumrah didn’t win the Test match — Siraj did,' says ex-Australia cricketer</title><description><![CDATA[Former Australian cricketer Brad Haddin sparked debate by suggesting Jasprit Bumrah didn't secure Test wins for India during their England tour, despite being their leading wicket-taker. Haddin praised Mohammed Siraj's leadership and eagerness in crucial moments, highlighting his resilience and impact on the team's performance, ultimately helping India level the series 2-2.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-didnt-win-the-test-match-mohammed-siraj-did-ex-australia-cricketer-says-in-bold-remark/articleshow/123131084.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-didnt-win-the-test-match-mohammed-siraj-did-ex-australia-cricketer-says-in-bold-remark/articleshow/123131084.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 08:01:10 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="142832" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123131080,imgsize-142832.cms"/></item><item><title>'What have we done?' — Why did Sam Altman 'feel useless' while testing ChatGPT-5</title><description><![CDATA[OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has voiced serious concerns regarding GPT-5's capabilities, likening its development to the Manhattan Project. He admitted feeling "useless" after witnessing its problem-solving abilities. While GPT-5 promises advancements, Altman fears its potential societal impact, including fraud and disruption.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/what-have-we-done-sam-altman-says-i-feel-useless-compares-chatgpt-5s-power-to-the-manhattan-project/articleshow/123112813.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/what-have-we-done-sam-altman-says-i-feel-useless-compares-chatgpt-5s-power-to-the-manhattan-project/articleshow/123112813.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 12:48:59 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="26742" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123113000,imgsize-26742.cms"/></item><item><title>'Miyan Magic' tops the charts: Siraj surpasses Bumrah for this big record</title><description><![CDATA[Mohammed Siraj has emerged as India's leading pacer in away Tests, surpassing Jasprit Bumrah. His stellar performance in the recent India-England series, where he took 23 wickets, solidified his position. Siraj's impactful spells, including a six-wicket haul at Birmingham and a crucial five-for at The Oval, were instrumental in India's victories.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/cricket-miyan-magic-tops-the-charts-mohammed-siraj-surpasses-jasprit-bumrah-for-this-big-record/articleshow/123130886.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/cricket-miyan-magic-tops-the-charts-mohammed-siraj-surpasses-jasprit-bumrah-for-this-big-record/articleshow/123130886.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 07:44:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="68838" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123130955,imgsize-68838.cms"/></item><item><title>WATCH: 'Bande in taange jama di goron ki' – Ex-India cricketer on Siraj</title><description><![CDATA[Yograj Singh praised Mohammed Siraj, drawing comparisons to Kapil Dev, and lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy amidst initial criticism. He emphasized the team's fighting spirit, viewing the series draw against England as a hard-fought victory. Yograj expressed immense pride in the Indian team's resilience and determination throughout the series, highlighting their unwavering commitment.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/watch-bande-in-taange-jama-di-goron-ki-yuvraj-singhs-father-compares-mohammed-siraj-to-kapil-dev/articleshow/123131565.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/watch-bande-in-taange-jama-di-goron-ki-yuvraj-singhs-father-compares-mohammed-siraj-to-kapil-dev/articleshow/123131565.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 08:36:29 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="68198" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123131570,imgsize-68198.cms"/></item><item><title>Angry at Mira Murati for refusing $1bn offer, Zuckerberg launched 'full-scale raid'</title><description><![CDATA[Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/angry-at-mira-murati-for-refusing-metas-1-billion-job-offer-ceo-mark-zuckerberg-launched-a-full-scale-/articleshow/123121189.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/angry-at-mira-murati-for-refusing-metas-1-billion-job-offer-ceo-mark-zuckerberg-launched-a-full-scale-/articleshow/123121189.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 19:30:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="44662" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123121185,imgsize-44662.cms"/></item><item><title>Nostalgia for SRH fans: Warner, Williamson walk out together to bat – Watch</title><description><![CDATA[The Hundred 2025 began at Lord's with a nostalgic reunion for Sunrisers Hyderabad fans as David Warner and Kane Williamson batted together for London Spirit. Despite the heartwarming moment, Oval Invincibles dominated, bowling out Spirit for 80. Rashid Khan and Sam Curran starred with the ball. The Invincibles chased the target swiftly, winning by six wickets.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/nostalgia-for-srh-fans-david-warner-and-kane-williamson-walk-out-together-at-lords-in-special-hundred-moment-watch/articleshow/123131292.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/nostalgia-for-srh-fans-david-warner-and-kane-williamson-walk-out-together-at-lords-in-special-hundred-moment-watch/articleshow/123131292.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 08:19:59 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="14244" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123131359,imgsize-14244.cms"/></item><item><title>Trump eyes tough tariffs: Targets nations buying Russian oil; claims 'talks with Russia soon'</title><description><![CDATA[Donald Trump hinted at potential tariff actions against countries like India and China for importing energy from Russia, citing concerns about fueling the war in Ukraine. He expressed dissatisfaction with India's trade practices and hinted at substantially raising tariffs due to their continued oil trade with Russia.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/trump-eyes-tough-tariffs-targets-nations-buying-russian-oil-claims-talks-with-russia-soon/articleshow/123130178.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/trump-eyes-tough-tariffs-targets-nations-buying-russian-oil-claims-talks-with-russia-soon/articleshow/123130178.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 06:44:03 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="528490" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123130204,imgsize-528490.cms"/></item><item><title>Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for August 6</title><description><![CDATA[Anand Rathi Shares suggests buying GRSE, Redington, and Raymond Realty. GRSE shows mean reversion and weekly reversal patterns. Redington indicates hidden bullish divergence and pullback setup. Raymond Realty displays momentum revival after correction.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/top-stock-recommendations-for-august-06-2025-grse-redington-raymond-realty-best-stocks-to-buy-today/articleshow/123117058.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/top-stock-recommendations-for-august-06-2025-grse-redington-raymond-realty-best-stocks-to-buy-today/articleshow/123117058.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 07:30:00 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="75496" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123117125,imgsize-75496.cms"/></item><item><title>WATCH: Fox on the field! Lord’s crowd erupts as wild visitor interrupts game</title><description><![CDATA[In a bizarre interruption at Lord's, a fox stole the show during The Hundred 2025 opener between London Spirit and Oval Invincibles. The furry intruder halted play, sparking amusement among spectators and commentators alike. Despite the delay, Oval Invincibles secured a six-wicket victory, chasing down London Spirit's 81-run target with Rashid Khan's stellar performance earning him Player of the Match.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/fox-on-the-field-lords-crowd-erupts-as-wild-visitor-interrupts-the-hundred-2025-season-opener-watch/articleshow/123129913.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/fox-on-the-field-lords-crowd-erupts-as-wild-visitor-interrupts-the-hundred-2025-season-opener-watch/articleshow/123129913.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 06:28:22 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="9414" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123129985,imgsize-9414.cms"/></item><item><title>Pakistan, Turkiye & Bangladesh not on list of invitees for RSS centenary celebration</title><description><![CDATA[The RSS will celebrate its centenary with a series of dialogues led by Mohan Bhagwat, focusing on its history, nation-building role, and future vision. While reaching out to various domestic and foreign entities, invitations will not be extended to the embassies of Pakistan, Turkiye, and Bangladesh due to the current geopolitical context.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/pakistan-turkiye-bangladesh-not-on-list-of-invitees-for-rss-centenary-celebration/articleshow/123128061.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/pakistan-turkiye-bangladesh-not-on-list-of-invitees-for-rss-centenary-celebration/articleshow/123128061.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:46:43 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="872253" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128085,imgsize-872253.cms"/></item><item><title>Call for debate on Op Sindoor backfired on opposition: PM Modi</title><description><![CDATA[PM Modi asserted that the opposition's demand for a debate on Operation Sindoor backfired, exposing their reluctance to acknowledge the armed forces' success. He urged NDA leaders to amplify the voice of a "New India" resolutely responding to terrorists. Modi also highlighted the historical significance of August 5 and encouraged participation in upcoming events like the Tiranga Yatra.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/call-for-debate-on-op-sindoor-backfired-on-opposition-pm-modi/articleshow/123127621.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/call-for-debate-on-op-sindoor-backfired-on-opposition-pm-modi/articleshow/123127621.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:18:33 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AKHILESH KUMAR SINGH</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1381551" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127622,imgsize-1381551.cms"/></item><item><title>'Son of Sardaar 2' box office: Ajay Devgn starrer sees steady growth</title><description><![CDATA[Despite facing competition, 'Son of Sardaar 2' has maintained a steady performance at the Indian box office, earning approximately Rs 2.50 crore on Day 5, bringing its total to around Rs 29.60 crore. The film's consistent weekday numbers and positive word-of-mouth suggest it will continue its momentum into the second weekend. 'Mahavatar Narsimha' continues to dominate the box office.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/son-of-sardaar-2-box-office-collection-day-5-ajay-devgn-and-mrunal-thakur-starrer-sees-steady-growth-matches-saiyaara-collections-on-tuesday/articleshow/123129300.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/son-of-sardaar-2-box-office-collection-day-5-ajay-devgn-and-mrunal-thakur-starrer-sees-steady-growth-matches-saiyaara-collections-on-tuesday/articleshow/123129300.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 05:47:17 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="47022" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123129426,imgsize-47022.cms"/></item><item><title>'Another way to spend my money': Trump jokes about nukes on roof; mimics missile launch</title><description><![CDATA[President Trump was spotted on the White House roof, accompanied by architect James McCrery, inspecting potential construction sites. Joking about installing "nuclear missiles," Trump highlighted his personal funding for projects. He also mentioned exploring ways to spend his money for the country.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/another-way-to-spend-my-money-trump-jokes-about-installing-nuclear-missiles-on-white-house-roof-makes-launch-gesture-towards-sky/articleshow/123125755.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/another-way-to-spend-my-money-trump-jokes-about-installing-nuclear-missiles-on-white-house-roof-makes-launch-gesture-towards-sky/articleshow/123125755.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 23:47:00 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1153614" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127554,imgsize-1153614.cms"/></item><item><title>As costs pinch, auto companies hike prices</title><description><![CDATA[After a period of softening, commodity prices are rising again, prompting auto companies to implement minor price hikes. Steel price increases, in particular, are causing concern, with analysts predicting continued hardening of raw material prices in the coming quarters. While the immediate impact on margins is limited, auto bosses are closely monitoring the situation as a potential headwind.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/as-costs-pinch-auto-cos-hike-prices/articleshow/123128877.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/as-costs-pinch-auto-cos-hike-prices/articleshow/123128877.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 04:59:32 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>NANDINI SEN GUPTA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1554945" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128915,imgsize-1554945.cms"/></item><item><title>India mulls new pilot training system as air traffic booms</title><description><![CDATA[India is contemplating a significant overhaul of its pilot training program, potentially introducing the multi-crew pilot license (MPL) system alongside the existing commercial pilot license (CPL). This move aims to address the burgeoning demand for pilots in the rapidly expanding Indian aviation sector.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-mulls-new-pilot-training-system-as-air-traffic-booms/articleshow/123128116.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-mulls-new-pilot-training-system-as-air-traffic-booms/articleshow/123128116.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:51:05 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="436350" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128139,imgsize-436350.cms"/></item><item><title>'Can I say I won them athletically': Trump jokes after receiving 1984 Olympic medals</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/can-i-say-i-won-them-athletically-trump-jokes-after-receiving-1984-olympic-medals-prepares-for-2028-games-with-new-task-force/articleshow/123127998.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/can-i-say-i-won-them-athletically-trump-jokes-after-receiving-1984-olympic-medals-prepares-for-2028-games-with-new-task-force/articleshow/123127998.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:44:25 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="975710" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128029,imgsize-975710.cms"/></item><item><title>Long-range precision hits had psychological impact on Pakistan: CDS</title><description><![CDATA[General Anil Chauhan stated that Operation Sindoor, involving long-range precision strikes during cross-border hostilities in May, had a significant psychological impact on Pakistan. He emphasized that the operation, which is still ongoing, aimed to achieve political goals through targeted action rather than territorial gains.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/long-range-precision-hits-had-psychological-impact-on-pakistan-cds/articleshow/123126940.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/long-range-precision-hits-had-psychological-impact-on-pakistan-cds/articleshow/123126940.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 00:41:36 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1204202" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123126990,imgsize-1204202.cms"/></item><item><title>'Saiyaara' collection: Ahaan Panday’s romantic film slows down to Rs 2.5 cr</title><description><![CDATA[Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's film 'Saiyaara' sees a drop in collections. The movie earned Rs 2.50 crore on its third Tuesday. Its total collection stands at Rs 304.60 crore. New releases like 'Mahavtar Narsimha', 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' pose competition. 'Saiyaara' faces a challenge with the upcoming release of 'War 2'.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/saiyaara-box-office-collection-day-19-ahaan-panday-and-aneet-paddas-romantic-film-slows-down-to-rs-2-5-crore-total-crosses-rs-304-crore-on-third-tuesday/articleshow/123129646.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/box-office/saiyaara-box-office-collection-day-19-ahaan-panday-and-aneet-paddas-romantic-film-slows-down-to-rs-2-5-crore-total-crosses-rs-304-crore-on-third-tuesday/articleshow/123129646.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 06:04:18 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="46930" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123129633,imgsize-46930.cms"/></item><item><title>'Totally out of control': Trump wants minors prosecuted; threatens federal control of DC</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/totally-out-of-control-trump-calls-for-prosecuting-minors-amid-washington-crime-concerns-threatens-to-take-federal-control/articleshow/123127632.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/totally-out-of-control-trump-calls-for-prosecuting-minors-amid-washington-crime-concerns-threatens-to-take-federal-control/articleshow/123127632.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:31:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="669243" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127635,imgsize-669243.cms"/></item><item><title>Travel loans overtake house renovation, medical: Study</title><description><![CDATA[Indians are increasingly financing their vacations with personal loans, surpassing home renovations and medical needs as the primary reason. A recent report indicates that 27% of borrowers took loans for travel in the first half of 2025, fueled by millennials and a rapidly growing Gen Z segment.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/travel-loans-overtake-house-renovation-medical-study/articleshow/123128948.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/travel-loans-overtake-house-renovation-medical-study/articleshow/123128948.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 05:05:57 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="829755" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128982,imgsize-829755.cms"/></item><item><title>'One of the worst orders': In a 1st, SC bars HC judge from hearing criminal cases</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court has strongly criticized Allahabad High Court's Justice Prashant Kumar for allowing criminal proceedings in a civil dispute, deeming it an "erroneous order." The SC bench, led by Justices Pardiwala and Mahadevan, questioned Justice Kumar's competence and barred him from handling criminal cases until retirement.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/one-of-the-worst-orders-in-a-1st-sc-bars-hc-judge-from-hearing-criminal-cases/articleshow/123127665.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/one-of-the-worst-orders-in-a-1st-sc-bars-hc-judge-from-hearing-criminal-cases/articleshow/123127665.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:50:45 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1701173" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127670,imgsize-1701173.cms"/></item><item><title>CISF in well, claims Kharge, Rijiju says House being misled</title><description><![CDATA[Rajya Sabha witnessed a heated debate between LoP Kharge and Deputy Chairman Harivansh regarding alleged CISF presence during opposition protests. Kharge claimed a violation of democratic rights, while the Chair and treasury benches refuted it, stating only Parliament marshals were present. The House later approved extending President's Rule in Manipur.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/cisf-in-well-claims-kharge-rijiju-says-house-being-misled/articleshow/123128165.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/cisf-in-well-claims-kharge-rijiju-says-house-being-misled/articleshow/123128165.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:56:35 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1218725" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123128200,imgsize-1218725.cms"/></item><item><title>Eye on Beijing, Delhi & Manila unite in strategic partnership</title><description><![CDATA[India and the Philippines have elevated their relationship to a strategic partnership, emphasizing expanded cooperation in defence, security, and maritime domains. This development includes finalizing terms for joint military exercises and India's support for freedom of navigation in the Indo-Pacific. Both nations voiced concerns over China's actions in the South China Sea, reaffirming the importance of the 2016 arbitral award.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/eye-on-beijing-delhi-manila-unite-in-strategic-partnership/articleshow/123126821.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/eye-on-beijing-delhi-manila-unite-in-strategic-partnership/articleshow/123126821.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 00:30:18 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SACHIN PARASHAR</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1612099" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123126862,imgsize-1612099.cms"/></item><item><title>SC grants Rs 4cr Mumbai flat as alimony, rejects Rs 12cr & BMW demand</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court, employing its Article 142 powers, dissolved a marriage by directing the husband to gift his wife a Rs 4 crore Mumbai flat. The court rejected the wife's demand for an additional Rs 12 crore and a BMW, deeming the flat sufficient alimony given her education and potential for self-support, while also considering the husband's current unemployment.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-grants-rs-4cr-mumbai-flat-as-alimony-rejects-rs-12cr-bmw-demand/articleshow/123127259.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-grants-rs-4cr-mumbai-flat-as-alimony-rejects-rs-12cr-bmw-demand/articleshow/123127259.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:04:34 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="2081141" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127280,imgsize-2081141.cms"/></item><item><title>EC suspends 4 officers for doctoring Bengal poll roll</title><description><![CDATA[The Election Commission has taken strict action against West Bengal officials for manipulating the electoral roll. Officers in Baruipur Purba and Moyna constituencies are suspended and face FIRs for adding names without verification and sharing login credentials. This follows reports of similar lapses by other officials.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/ec-suspends-4-officers-for-doctoring-bengal-poll-roll/articleshow/123127972.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/ec-suspends-4-officers-for-doctoring-bengal-poll-roll/articleshow/123127972.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:39:37 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>BHARTI JAIN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="55088" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127981,imgsize-55088.cms"/></item><item><title>Central green nod not needed for constructions of 20,000-150,000 sqm</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court has reactivated stalled construction projects, including housing, industrial sheds, and educational institutions, with covered areas between 20,000 and 1,50,000 square meters. These projects can now proceed with clearance from the State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA), exempting them from central environmental clearance.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/central-green-nod-not-needed-for-constructions-of-20000-150000-sqm/articleshow/123127694.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/central-green-nod-not-needed-for-constructions-of-20000-150000-sqm/articleshow/123127694.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 03:05:52 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1445974" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127695,imgsize-1445974.cms"/></item><item><title>Big INDIA bloc parties reject smaller allies' plea to find a way to let Parliament run</title><description><![CDATA[Opposition members of the INDIA bloc are divided over the ongoing parliamentary disruption concerning the special intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls. While some MPs urged for a return to normal proceedings, larger parties insisted on holding the government accountable for allegedly evading discussion on the critical issue.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/big-india-bloc-parties-reject-smaller-allies-plea-to-find-a-way-to-let-parliament-run/articleshow/123127569.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/big-india-bloc-parties-reject-smaller-allies-plea-to-find-a-way-to-let-parliament-run/articleshow/123127569.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:59:15 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SUBODH GHILDIYAL</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1595665" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127595,imgsize-1595665.cms"/></item><item><title>SC asks Bar Council to probe controversy over 'ghost litigant'</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court is grappling with a perplexing case involving a 'ghost litigant' who secured a favorable order based on a fabricated compromise. With lawyers denying involvement, the court has directed the Bar Council of India to investigate the matter.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-asks-bar-council-to-probe-controversy-over-ghost-litigant/articleshow/123127663.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-asks-bar-council-to-probe-controversy-over-ghost-litigant/articleshow/123127663.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:41:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="810070" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127664,imgsize-810070.cms"/></item><item><title>SC remarks on Rahul Gandhi 'extraordinary, unwarranted': Opposition</title><description><![CDATA[The INDIA bloc has criticized the Supreme Court's remarks on Rahul Gandhi, deeming them an encroachment on the democratic rights of political parties to address national issues. They asserted the opposition's duty to hold the government accountable, especially concerning border defense failures.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-remarks-on-rahul-gandhi-extraordinary-unwarranted-opposition/articleshow/123127631.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-remarks-on-rahul-gandhi-extraordinary-unwarranted-opposition/articleshow/123127631.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 02:26:49 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="687132" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127638,imgsize-687132.cms"/></item><item><title>UP fine with Banke Bihari panel headed by ex-judge but says he must be 'Sanatani Hindu'</title><description><![CDATA[The Uttar Pradesh government has agreed to the Supreme Court's proposal to form an interim committee, headed by a retired High Court judge, to manage the Banke Bihari temple. This is pending the Allahabad HC's decision on the ordinance regarding the temple's takeover for development. The state proposes a committee composition, while Goswamis object, claiming hereditary control.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/up-fine-with-banke-bihari-panel-headed-by-ex-judge-but-says-he-must-be-sanatani-hindu/articleshow/123127314.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/up-fine-with-banke-bihari-panel-headed-by-ex-judge-but-says-he-must-be-sanatani-hindu/articleshow/123127314.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:09:52 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1168695" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127353,imgsize-1168695.cms"/></item><item><title>Gaya’s GAY airport code sparks unease but can’t be altered</title><description><![CDATA[The Indian government has declined a request to change Gaya International Airport's code 'GAY', citing International Air Transport Association (IATA) protocols. Civil Aviation Minister Murlidhar Mohol stated codes are altered only for safety concerns. The 'GAY' code, in use since 2011, reflects the city's name origin, linked to 'Gyan' (enlightenment).]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/gay-code-for-gaya-airport-cant-be-altered-aviation-min/articleshow/123121093.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/gay-code-for-gaya-airport-cant-be-altered-aviation-min/articleshow/123121093.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 19:22:44 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="731093" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127561,imgsize-731093.cms"/></item><item><title>ED quizzes Anil Ambani for 8 hours in laundering case</title><description><![CDATA[Anil Ambani faced extensive questioning by the Enforcement Directorate regarding foreign assets and financial transactions linked to his group entities. The investigation centers on alleged money laundering, round-tripping of funds, and related-party transactions, particularly involving Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Home Finance. Ambani has requested additional time to provide necessary financial details.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/ed-quizzes-anil-ambani-for-8-hours-in-laundering-case/articleshow/123127443.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/ed-quizzes-anil-ambani-for-8-hours-in-laundering-case/articleshow/123127443.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:22:34 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="623146" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127450,imgsize-623146.cms"/></item><item><title>UK coroner confirms Sunjay Kapur died ‘natural death’, police say death ‘non-suspicious’</title><description><![CDATA[Industrialist Sunjay Kapur's death, chairman of Sona Comstar, was due to natural causes, the Surrey coroner ruled, dismissing his mother's claims of foul play. Kapur, a US citizen, died from heart disease, confirmed by a post-mortem. Surrey police deemed the death non-suspicious, despite Rani Kapur's letter demanding investigation into a potential conspiracy.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/uk/uk-coroner-confirms-sunjay-kapur-died-natural-death-police-say-death-non-suspicious/articleshow/123126098.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/uk/uk-coroner-confirms-sunjay-kapur-died-natural-death-police-say-death-non-suspicious/articleshow/123126098.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 23:58:41 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>NAOMI CANTON</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="389553" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123126072,imgsize-389553.cms"/></item><item><title>370 abrogation anniversary: ‘New J&K’ for LG; ‘Black Day’ for others</title><description><![CDATA[The sixth anniversary of Article 370's abrogation saw contrasting reactions in Jammu and Kashmir. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha hailed it as the dawn of a new era, emphasizing improved security and justice for terror victims' families.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/370-abrogation-anniversary-new-jk-for-lg-black-day-for-others/articleshow/123126628.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/370-abrogation-anniversary-new-jk-for-lg-black-day-for-others/articleshow/123126628.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 00:19:32 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>NASEER GANAI AND SANJAY KHAJURIA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1512589" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123126623,imgsize-1512589.cms"/></item><item><title>Dwyane Wade on LeBron James snubbing Bulls: Derrick Rose failed pitch; 2010 saga revisited</title><description><![CDATA[NBA legend Dwyane Wade revealed LeBron James' 2010 decision to decline the Chicago Bulls' offer. Wade, contemplating a return to his hometown team, was surprised by a call from James. The call revealed Miami Heat's plan to acquire three stars. Wade admitted he hadn't considered playing with James, relishing their rivalry.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nba/top-stories/dwyane-wade-reacts-as-lebron-james-passed-on-chicago-bulls-in-2010-after-derrick-rose-failed-to-recruit-him/articleshow/123127420.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nba/top-stories/dwyane-wade-reacts-as-lebron-james-passed-on-chicago-bulls-in-2010-after-derrick-rose-failed-to-recruit-him/articleshow/123127420.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:27:28 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GLOBAL SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="44558" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127445,imgsize-44558.cms"/></item><item><title>Laptop on lap, phone in pocket? Study flags risk to sperm count</title><description><![CDATA[A new study by Calcutta University and the Institute of Reproductive Medicine suggests a link between prolonged mobile phone and laptop use and male infertility. The research, involving 1,200 men, found that radiation exposure, especially among those with specific genetic mutations, significantly increases the risk of azoospermia, challenging previous studies that dismissed such connections.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/laptop-on-lap-phone-in-pocket-study-flags-risk-to-sperm-count/articleshow/123127489.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/laptop-on-lap-phone-in-pocket-study-flags-risk-to-sperm-count/articleshow/123127489.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:34:10 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>POULAMI ROY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1181054" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127501,imgsize-1181054.cms"/></item><item><title>PSUs shouldn't behave like Shylock to become money-minded: SC</title><description><![CDATA[The Supreme Court criticized Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited (GUVNL) for prioritizing commercial interests over its role as a model public sector entity. The court rejected GUVNL's attempt to enforce a fixed tariff rate on wind power producers, emphasizing the government's renewable energy promotion policies. GUVNL's conduct was deemed unfair and likened to that of a 'Shylock'.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/psus-shouldnt-behave-like-shylock-to-become-money-minded-sc/articleshow/123127464.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/psus-shouldnt-behave-like-shylock-to-become-money-minded-sc/articleshow/123127464.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 06 Aug 2025 01:27:55 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1289834" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123127476,imgsize-1289834.cms"/></item><item><title>'Will not call Trump': Brazil's Lula refuses to contact US prez; 50% tariffs remain unresolved</title><description><![CDATA[President Lula da Silva refuses to call Donald Trump amid escalating tensions over tariffs and sanctions. The US imposed a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports, while also sanctioning a Brazilian Supreme Court Justice. Brazil rejects US claims of political persecution, asserting judicial independence, as diplomatic efforts to ease the rift struggle to gain traction in Washington.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/rest-of-world/will-not-call-trump-brazils-lula-refuses-to-contact-us-prez-50-tariffs-remain-unresolved/articleshow/123125036.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/rest-of-world/will-not-call-trump-brazils-lula-refuses-to-contact-us-prez-50-tariffs-remain-unresolved/articleshow/123125036.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 05 Aug 2025 23:29:13 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="797498" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123125176,imgsize-797498.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

       <title><![CDATA[Liverpool Youth Product Tyler Morton Joins Lyon]]></title>
       <link><![CDATA[https://sports.ndtv.com/football/liverpool-youth-product-tyler-morton-joins-lyon-9027049]]></link>

      <description><![CDATA[The Surrey Coroner’s Office has been approached for details, even as a coroner's report from the office of Kapur’s wife – Priya Sachdev Kapur – has been referenced across Indian media reports, giving the industrialist’s cause of death as the result of “left ventricular hypertrophy and ischemic heart disease”.       <description><![CDATA[The Genius Act marks a turning point for stablecoins, offering them legal legitimacy and regulatory clarity. “This legitimisation of stablecoins is certainly going to give a huge boost,” says Eswar Prasad, Professor at Cornell University.       <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK.       <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>
